meanings.definition: Showing or characterized by a patronizing or superior attitude towards others.
meanings.sent1: She spoke in a condescending tone to the new student.
meanings.sent2: His condescending behavior made others feel small.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a condescending look to the dog, as if saying, 'I'm better than you.'
meanings.sent4: The condescending clouds looked down on the tiny town below.
meanings.sent5: The condescending teacher made the students feel inferior with her remarks.

meanings.sent1: The condescending attitude of the wealthy man was off-putting.
meanings.sent2: She always wore a condescending expression when talking about her achievements.
meanings.sent3: The condescending squirrel acted as if it ruled the entire park.
meanings.sent4: The condescending mountain stood tall above the surrounding peaks.
meanings.sent5: His condescending smile revealed his belief in his own superiority.
